The blue color of the flame in the first experiment doesn't result from the burning hydrogen, but from the emission of electromagnetic radiation from excited copper ions. Electrons inside the copper ion "fall" back onto the ground state, and the energy difference is emitted as electromagnetic radiation. Due to the substance specific amount of energy, the radiation is in the spectrum of visible light.
